what: Modelling Species Distribution in the Southern Ocean
title: Data for Southern Ocean species distribution modelling
text: Species Distribution Modelling correlative approach helps assess relationship species occurrence records surrounding environmental conditions. Studying distribution benthic species Southern Ocean constitutes interesting approach interpolate little amount information broad scale poorly accessible area. provide set environmental descriptors suitable modelling work. present vignette describes procedure select download .

title: Data for Southern Ocean species distribution modelling
text: present dataset composed 58 environmental descriptors, set 0.1 degree grid-cell resolution, Southern Ocean extent (80 45 degrees S, -180 180 degrees longitude). Layers provided netCDF file format. 1/ depth  Description: Bathymetry. Dowloaded GEBCO 2014 (0.0083 degrees = 30sec arcmin resolution) set resolution 0.1 degrees. completed bathymetry layer manually corrected provided Fabri-Ruiz et al. (2017)  Value range: -8038.722 - 0  Units: m  Source: study. Derived GEBCO  URL: https://www.gebco.net/data_and_products/gridded_bathymetry_data/  Citation: Fabri-Ruiz S, Saucede T, Danis B David B (2017). Southern Ocean Echinoids database_An updated version Antarctic, Sub-Antarctic cold temperate echinoid database. ZooKeys, (697), 1. 2/ geomorphology  Description: Last update biodiversity.aq portal. Derived O’Brien et al. (2009) seafloor geomorphic feature dataset. Mapping based GEBCO contours, ETOPO2, seismic lines).  Value range: 27 categories  Units: categorical  Source: study. Derived Australian Antarctic Data Centre  URL: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data  Citation: O’Brien, P.E., Post, .L., Romeyn, R. (2009) Antarctic-wide geomorphology aid habitat mapping locating vulnerable marine ecosystems. CCAMLR VME Workshop 2009. Document WS-VME-09/10 3/ sediments  Description: Sediment features  Value range: 14 categories  Units: categorical  Source: Griffiths 2014 (unpublished)  URL: http://share.biodiversity.aq/GIS/antarctic/ 4/ slope Description: Seafloor slope derived bathymetry terrain function raster R package. Computation according Horn (1981), ie option neighbor=8. computation done GEBCO bathymetry layer (0.0083 degrees resolution) resolution changed 0.1 degrees. Unit set degrees. Value range: 0.000252378 - 16.94809 Units: degrees Source: study. Derived GEBCO URL: https://www.gebco.net/data_and_products/gridded_bathymetry_data/ Citation: Horn, B.K.P., 1981. Hill shading reflectance map. Proceedings IEEE 69:14-47 5/ roughness  Description: Seafloor roughness derived bathymetry terrain function raster R package. Roughness difference maximum minimum value cell 8 surrounding cells. computation done GEBCO bathymetry layer (0.0083 degrees resolution) resolution changed 0.1 degrees. Value range: 0 - 5171.278 Units: unitless Source: study. Derived GEBCO URL: https://www.gebco.net/data_and_products/gridded_bathymetry_data/ 6/ mixed_layer_depth Description: Summer mixed layer depth climatology ARGOS data. Regridded 2-degree grid using nearest neighbour interpolation Value range: 13.79615 - 461.5424 Units: m Source: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data 7/ seasurface_current_speed Description: Current speed near surface (2.5m depth), derived CAISOM model (Galton-Fenzi et al. 2012, based ROMS model) Value range: 1.50E-04 - 1.7 Units: m/s Source: study. Derived Australia Antarctic Data Centre URL: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data Citation: see Galton-Fenzi BK, Hunter JR, Coleman R, Marsland SJ, Warner RC (2012) Modeling basal melting marine ice accretion Amery Ice Shelf. Journal Geophysical Research: Oceans, 117, C09031.http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2012jc008214, 8/ seafloor_current_speed  Description: Current speed near sea floor, derived CAISOM model (Galton-Fenzi et al. 2012, based ROMS) Value range: 3.40E-04 - 0.53 Units: m/s Source: study. Derived Australia Antarctic Data Centre URL: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data Citation: see Galton-Fenzi BK, Hunter JR, Coleman R, Marsland SJ, Warner RC (2012) Modeling basal melting marine ice accretion Amery Ice Shelf. title: Data for Southern Ocean species distribution modelling
text: first steps download data define directory data stored. example, use temporary folder. Now can ask blueant fetch unpack data: verbose = TRUE argument helps display progress output. completed, status object provides information files downloaded. particular, downloaded netCDF files can listed : can open data raster package  can also consult blueant vignette information.
code: library(blueant) my_data_directory <- tempdir()  ## the data source we want data_source <- sources_sdm("Southern Ocean marine environmental data")  ## put these together into a blueant configuration config <- bb_config(my_data_directory) %>% bb_add(data_source) config ## Local file root: /tmp/RtmpZFYE70  ##  ## # Data group:  Modelling  ##  ## ##  Southern Ocean marine environmental data  ## A collection of gridded marine environmental data layers suitable for use in Southern Ocean species distribution modelling. All environmental layers have been generated at a spatial resolution of 0.1 degrees, covering the Southern Ocean extent (80 degrees S - 45 degrees S, -180 - 180 degrees). The layers include information relating to bathymetry, sea ice, ocean currents, primary production, particulate organic carbon, and other oceanographic data.  ## Approximate size: 0.1 GB  ## Documentation link:  https://doi.org/10.26179/5b8f30e30d4f3  ## Citation:  Guillaumot C, Raymond B, Danis B (2018) Marine environmental data layers for Southern Ocean species distribution modelling. Australian Antarctic Data Centre - doi:10.26179/5b8f30e30d4f3  ## License:  CC-BY  ## Local file system paths: /tmp/RtmpZFYE70/ ## Associated access functions:  raster::stack status <- bb_sync(config, verbose = TRUE) ## title: Blueant
text: Blueant provides set data source configurations use bowerbird package. data sources themed around Antarctic Southern Ocean data, include range oceanographic, meteorological, topographic, environmental data sets. Blueant allow download data external data providers local file system, keep data collection date.

previous_headings: Blueant
title: Blueant
code: install.packages("devtools") library(devtools) install_github("AustralianAntarcticDivision/blueant", build_vignettes = TRUE)

previous_headings: Blueant > Usage overview
title: Blueant
text: Build configuration first defining global options destination local file system. Usually choose destination data directory persistent location suitable data library. demonstration purposes ’ll just use temporary directory: Add data sources provided blueant. summary sources given end document. ’ll use “George V bathymetry” data source example: data source fairly small (around 200MB, see mysrc$collection_size). sure check collection_size parameter chosen data source running synchronization. collections quite large (see summary table bottom document).
code: library(blueant) my_data_dir <- tempdir() cf <- bb_config(local_file_root = my_data_dir) mysrc <- sources("George V bathymetry") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

previous_headings: Blueant > Usage overview
title: Blueant
text: configuration defined data source added , can run sync process. set verbose = TRUE see additional progress output: Congratulations! now local copy data set. files data set stored data-source-specific subdirectory local file root: contents directory: data sources provided blueant can read, manipulated, plotted using range R packages, including RAADTools raster. case data files netcdf, can read raster:
code: status <- bb_sync(cf, verbose = TRUE) bb_data_source_dir(cf) list.files(bb_data_source_dir(cf), recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE) library(raster) x <- raster(file.path(bb_data_source_dir(cf), "gvdem500m_v3.nc")) plot(x)

title: Blueant
text: data providers require users log . indicated authentication_note column configuration table. sources, need provide user name password, e.g.:
code: src <- sources(name="CMEMS global gridded SSH reprocessed (1993-ongoing)") src$user <- "yourusername" src$password <- "yourpassword" cf <- bb_add(cf, src)  ## or, using the pipe operator mysrc <- bb_example_sources("CMEMS global gridded SSH reprocessed (1993-ongoing)") %>%   bb_modify_source(user = "yourusername", password = "yourpassword") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

previous_headings: Blueant > Nuances > Writing and modifying data sources
title: Blueant
text: Sometimes might want part data collection. Perhaps want years long-term collection, perhaps data provided multiple formats need one. data source uses bb_handler_rget method, can restrict downloaded modifying arguments passed data source’s method parameter, particularly accept_follow, reject_follow, accept_download, reject_download options. example, CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration data arranged yearly directories, fairly easy restrict , say, 2017 data: Alternatively, data sources divided subdirectories, one replace whole-data-source source_url one point specific yearly () subdirectories. example, default source_url CERSAT sea ice data ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/ (yearly subdirectories). e.g. 2016 2017 data :
code: mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration")  ## first make sure that the data source doesn't already have an accept_follow parameter defined "accept_follow" %in% names(mysrc$method[[1]])  ## nope, so we can safely go ahead and impose our own mysrc$method[[1]]$accept_follow <- "/2017" cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc) mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration") mysrc$source_url[[1]] <- c("ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2016/",                         "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2017/") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

title: Blueant
text: global importance mesopelagic fish increasingly recognised, remain poorly studied. particularly true Southern Ocean, mesopelagic fishes key predators prey, remote environment makes sampling challenging. Despite , multiple national Antarctic research programs undertaken regional sampling mesopelagic fish several decades. However, data dispersed, sampling methodologies often differ precluding comparisons limiting synthetic analyses. , collated standardised existing survey data  mesopelagic fishes circumpolar dataset called Myctobase. date, Myctobase holds 17,491 occurrence 11,190 abundance records 4780 net hauls 72 different research cruises. Data include trait-based information individuals including standard length, weight life-stage. Data span across 37 years 1991 2019. Detailed metadata also provided sampling event including  date, time, position (latitude, longitude, depth), sampling protocol, net type, net mesh size, tow speed, volume filtered haul type (routine, target, random).  dataset comprised three comma-separated files. first file (event.csv) describes survey methodology. second file (groupOccurrence.csv) contains catch data linked survey methodology event ID. final file (individualOccurrence.csv) contains measurements individuals. row contains event occurrence ID, links measurement first second file. See associated metadata record definitions units variable  'definitions.xlsx'. final dataset subject quality control validation processes. Entries ambiguous incomplete records identified '0' column labelled 'validation' (event.csv) description missing data can found proceeding column labelled 'validationDescription'. taxonomic name  individual verified  World Register Marine Species (http://www.marinespecies.org/). Approximate size: 0.009 GB Documentation link: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6809070

previous_headings: Blueant > Data source summary > Data group: Oceanographic
what: Effects of Sound on the Marine Environment
title: Blueant
text: ESME uses publically available environmental data sources provide detailed information ocean, form four primary databases supplied Oceanographic Atmospheric Master Library (OAML). (1) Bottom Sediment Type (BST) v 2.0 : database provides information type sediment ocean bottom, affects acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 0.1 min. (2) Digital Bathymetry Database (DBDB) v 5.4 : database provides information depth water column. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 1 min, .5 min, .1 min, 0.05 min. (3) Generalized Digital Environment Model (GDEM) v 3.0 : database provides water temperature water salinity data selected month months time, used calculate changes speed sound water. Available data resolution: 15 min. (4) Surface Marine Gridded Climatology (SMGC) v 2.0 : database provides wind speed data selected month months. Wind speed, consequently surface roughness wave height, affect surface’s acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolution: 60 min. Approximate size: 5 GB Documentation link: https://esme.bu.edu/index.shtml

previous_headings: Usage overview
title: Antarctic and Southern Ocean Environmental Data Sources
text: Build configuration first defining global options destination local file system. Usually choose destination data directory persistent location, suitable data library. demonstration purposes ’ll just use temporary directory: Add data sources provided blueant. summary sources given end document. ’ll use “George V bathymetry” data source example: data source fairly small (around 200MB, see mysrc$collection_size). sure check collection_size parameter chosen data source running synchronization. collections quite large (see summary table bottom document).
code: library(blueant) my_data_dir <- tempdir() cf <- bb_config(local_file_root = my_data_dir) mysrc <- sources("George V bathymetry") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

previous_headings: Nuances > Writing and modifying data sources
title: Antarctic and Southern Ocean Environmental Data Sources
text: Sometimes might want part data collection. Perhaps want years long-term collection, perhaps data provided multiple formats need one. data source uses bb_handler_rget method, can restrict downloaded modifying arguments passed data source’s method parameter, particularly accept_follow, reject_follow, accept_download, reject_download options. example, CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration data arranged yearly directories, fairly easy restrict , say, 2017 data: Alternatively, data sources divided subdirectories, one replace whole-data-source source_url one point specific yearly () subdirectories. example, default source_url CERSAT sea ice data ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/ (yearly subdirectories). e.g. 2016 2017 data :
code: mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration")  ## first make sure that the data source doesn't already have an accept_follow parameter defined "accept_follow" %in% names(mysrc$method[[1]])  ## nope, so we can safely go ahead and impose our own mysrc$method[[1]]$accept_follow <- "/2017" cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc) mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration") mysrc$source_url[[1]] <- c(   "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2016/",   "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2017/") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

title: Antarctic and Southern Ocean Environmental Data Sources
text: global importance mesopelagic fish increasingly recognised, remain poorly studied. particularly true Southern Ocean, mesopelagic fishes key predators prey, remote environment makes sampling challenging. Despite , multiple national Antarctic research programs undertaken regional sampling mesopelagic fish several decades. However, data dispersed, sampling methodologies often differ precluding comparisons limiting synthetic analyses. , collated standardised existing survey data  mesopelagic fishes circumpolar dataset called Myctobase. date, Myctobase holds 17,491 occurrence 11,190 abundance records 4780 net hauls 72 different research cruises. Data include trait-based information individuals including standard length, weight life-stage. Data span across 37 years 1991 2019. Detailed metadata also provided sampling event including  date, time, position (latitude, longitude, depth), sampling protocol, net type, net mesh size, tow speed, volume filtered haul type (routine, target, random).   dataset comprised three comma-separated files. first file (event.csv) describes survey methodology. second file (groupOccurrence.csv) contains catch data linked survey methodology event ID. final file (individualOccurrence.csv) contains measurements individuals. row contains event occurrence ID, links measurement first second file. See associated metadata record definitions units variable  ‘definitions.xlsx’.  final dataset subject quality control validation processes. Entries ambiguous incomplete records identified ‘0’ column labelled ‘validation’ (event.csv) description missing data can found proceeding column labelled ‘validationDescription’.  taxonomic name  individual verified  World Register Marine Species (http://www.marinespecies.org/). previous_headings: Data source summary > Data group: Oceanographic
what: Effects of Sound on the Marine Environment
title: Antarctic and Southern Ocean Environmental Data Sources
text: ESME uses publically available environmental data sources provide detailed information ocean, form four primary databases supplied Oceanographic Atmospheric Master Library (OAML). (1) Bottom Sediment Type (BST) v 2.0 : database provides information type sediment ocean bottom, affects acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 0.1 min. (2) Digital Bathymetry Database (DBDB) v 5.4 : database provides information depth water column. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 1 min, .5 min, .1 min, 0.05 min. (3) Generalized Digital Environment Model (GDEM) v 3.0 : database provides water temperature water salinity data selected month months time, used calculate changes speed sound water. Available data resolution: 15 min. (4) Surface Marine Gridded Climatology (SMGC) v 2.0 : database provides wind speed data selected month months. Wind speed, consequently surface roughness wave height, affect surface’s acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolution: 60 min. Approximate size: 5 GB Documentation link: https://esme.bu.edu/index.shtml

text: existing regional bathymetric grid Kerguelen Plateau, south-west Indian Ocean, updated using new singlebeam echosounder data commercial fishing research voyages, new multibeam swath bathymetry data. Source bathymetry data varies International Hydrographic Organisation (IHO) S44 Order 1a 2. source data subjected area-based editing remove data spikes, combined previous Sexton (2005) grid produce new grid resolution 0.001-arcdegree. Satellite-derived datasets used provide island topography fill areas data. new grid improves resolution morphological features observed earlier grids, including submarine volcanic hills top Kerguelen Plateau complex submarine channels draining southern flank bank Heard Island sits Approximate size: 0.7 GB Documentation link: http://pid.geoscience.gov.au/dataset/ga/71552

title: Altimetry data sources — sources_altimetry
text: "CMEMS global gridded SSH reprocessed (1993-ongoing)": Global Ocean - Multimission altimeter satellite gridded sea surface heights derived variables computed respect twenty-year mean. missions homogenized respect reference mission currently OSTM/Jason-2 "CMEMS global gridded SSH near-real-time": near-real-time version 'CMEMS global gridded SSH reprocessed (1993-ongoing)' "CNES-CLS2013 Mean Dynamic Topography": CNES-CLS2013 Mean dynamic topography 1993-2012 period sea surface height geoid. MDT_CNES-CLS13 estimate ocean MDT 1993-2012 period. Since April 2014 (Duacs 2014, v15.0 version), Ssalto/Duacs (M)SLA products computed relative 1993-2012 period consistent new MDT CNES-CLS13. Based 2 years GOCE data, 7 years GRACE data, 20 years altimetry -situ data (hydrologic drifters data) "Gridded Sea Level Heights geostrophic currents - Antarctic Ocean": Experimental Ssalto/Duacs gridded multimission altimeter products dedicated Antarctic Ocean "Near-real-time finite size Lyapunov exponents": products provide exponential rate separation particle trajectories initialized nearby advected altimetry velocities. FSLEs highlight transport barriers control horizontal exchange water eddy cores. "Delayed-time finite size Lyapunov exponents": products provide exponential rate separation particle trajectories initialized nearby advected altimetry velocities. FSLEs highlight transport barriers control horizontal exchange water eddy cores. "WAVERYS Global Ocean Waves Reanalysis": global wave reanalysis describing past sea states since years 1993. returned tibble contains information source.

title: Oceanographic data sources — sources_oceanographic
text: "CSIRO Atlas Regional Seas 2009": CARS digital climatology, atlas seasonal ocean water properties "World Ocean Atlas 2009": World Ocean Atlas 2009 included convenience superseded World Ocean Atlas 2013 V2 "World Ocean Atlas 2013 V2": World Ocean Atlas 2013 version 2 (WOA13 V2) set objectively analyzed (1 degree grid) climatological fields situ temperature, salinity, dissolved oxygen, Apparent Oxygen Utilization (AOU), percent oxygen saturation, phosphate, silicate, nitrate standard depth levels annual, seasonal, monthly compositing periods World Ocean. also includes associated statistical fields observed oceanographic profile data interpolated standard depth levels 5 degree, 1 degree, 0.25 degree grids "Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)": Argo float data Global Data Access Centre Monterey, USA (US Global Ocean Data Assimilation Experiment). multi-profile netcdf files divided ocean basin. Accepts region parameter values "pacific" (default), "atlantic", /"indian". Also accepts years parameter: optional vector years download data "Argo profile data": Argo profile data, default Global Data Access Centre Monterey, USA (US Global Ocean Data Assimilation Experiment). DAC can changed specifying dac_url parameter (see example ). Also see bb_handler_argo description parameters source accepts. "Effects Sound Marine Environment": ESME uses publically available environmental data sources provide detailed information ocean: (1) Bottom Sediment Type (BST) v 2.0, (2) Digital Bathymetry Database (DBDB) v 5.4, (3) Generalized Digital Environment Model (GDEM) v 3.0, (4) Surface Marine Gridded Climatology (SMGC) v 2.0" returned tibble contains information source.

title: Oceanographic data sources — sources_oceanographic
code: if (FALSE) { ## define a configuration and add the Atlas of Regional Seas data to it cf <- bb_config("/my/file/root") src <- sources_oceanographic("CSIRO Atlas of Regional Seas 2009") cf <- bb_add(cf,src)  ## Argo data, Pacific ocean basin only, all years src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)", region="pacific")  ## Argo data, Pacific ocean basin for 2018 only src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)",   region="pacific", years=2018)  ## Argo data, all ocean basins and for 2017 and 2018 only src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)",   region=c("pacific", "indian", "atlantic"), years=c(2017, 2018))  ## Argo merge profile data, from the French GDAC (ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/argo/) ## Only download profiles from institutions "CS" or "IN", south of 30S, ##  with parameter "NITRATE" or "CHLA" src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo profile data", profile_type = "merge",                              dac_url = "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/argo/",                              institutions = c("CS", "IN"),                              latitude_filter = function(z) z < -30,                              parameters = c("CHLA", "NITRATE")) }

title: Sea ice data sources — sources_seaice
text: Data sources providing (primarily satellite-derived) sea ice data: "NSIDC SMMR-SSM/Nasateam sea ice concentration": Passive microwave estimates sea ice concentration 25km spatial resolution. Daily monthly resolution, available 1-Oct-1978 near-present. Data undergo quality checking process updated annually. recent data available via 'NSIDC SMMR-SSM/Nasateam near-real-time sea ice concentration' source. Accepts hemisphere values "south", "north", "". Accepts time_resolution values "day" "month". Accepts years parameter vector years. "NSIDC SMMR-SSM/Nasateam near-real-time sea ice concentration": Near-real-time passive microwave estimates sea ice concentration 25km, daily resolution. older, quality-controlled data see 'NSIDC SMMR-SSM/Nasateam sea ice concentration' source "NSIDC passive microwave supporting files": Grids support files NSIDC passive microwave sea ice data "Nimbus Ice Edge Points Nimbus Visible Imagery": data set (NmIcEdg2) estimates location North South Pole sea ice edges various times mid late 1960s, based recovered Nimbus 1 (1964), Nimbus 2 (1966), Nimbus 3 (1969) visible imagery "Artist AMSR-E sea ice concentration": Passive microwave estimates daily sea ice concentration 6.25km spatial resolution, 19-Jun-2002 2-Oct-2011. Accepts formats "geotiff" /"hdf" "Artist AMSR-E supporting files": Grids support files Artist AMSR-E passive microwave sea ice data "Artist AMSR2 near-real-time sea ice concentration": Near-real-time passive microwave estimates daily sea ice concentration 6.25km spatial resolution, 24-July-2012 present "Artist AMSR2 near-real-time 3.125km sea ice concentration": Near-real-time passive microwave estimates daily sea ice concentration 3.125km spatial resolution, 24-July-2012 present "Artist AMSR2 supporting files": Grids landmasks Artist AMSR2 passive microwave sea ice data "CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration": Passive microwave sea ice concentration data 12.5km resolution, 3-Dec-1991 present "CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration supporting files": Grids CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration data "Sea ice lead climatologies": Long-term relative sea ice lead frequencies Arctic (November - April 2002/03 - 2018/19) Antarctic (April - September 2003 - 2019) derived Moderate-Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) imagery "MODIS Composite Based Maps East Antarctic Fast Ice Coverage": Maps East Antarctic landfast sea-ice extent, generated approx. 250,000 1 km visible/thermal infrared cloud-free MODIS composite imagery (augmented AMSR-E 6.25-km sea-ice concentration composite imagery required). Coverage 2000-03-01 2008-12-31 "Circum-Antarctic landfast sea ice extent": maps Antarctic landfast sea ice, derived NASA MODIS imagery. 24 maps per year, spanning 18 year period March 2000 Feb 2018 "National Ice Center Antarctic daily sea ice charts": USNIC Daily Ice Edge product depicts daily sea ice pack red (8-10/10ths greater sea ice), Marginal Ice Zone (MIZ) yellow. marginal ice zone transition open ocean (ice free) pack ice. MIZ dynamic affects air-ocean heat transport, well significant factor navigational safety. daily ice edge analyzed sea ice experts using multiple sources near real time satellite data, derived satellite products, buoy data, weather, analyst interpretation current sea ice conditions. product current depiction location ice edge vice satellite derived ice edge product. Accepts formats parameter can one "filled" "vector". Accepts years parameter restrict data certain years "Polarview Sentinel-1 imagery": Sentinel-1 imagery polarview.aq. Accepts acquisition_date parameter (default last four days including today), formats parameter (one "jpg", "geotiff", default ), polygon parameter, polygon within search - either WKT polygon string EPSG:3031 projection, object class sfc_POLYGON, converted WKT string internally

text: "Smith Sandwell bathymetry": Global seafloor topography satellite altimetry ship depth soundings "GEBCO 2014 bathymetry": Global bathymetric grid 30 arc-second intervals "GEBCO 2019 bathymetry": Global bathymetric grid 15 arc-second intervals "GEBCO 2021 bathymetry": GEBCO_2021 Grid global terrain model ocean land, providing elevation data, meters, 15 arc-second interval grid. includes number additonal data sets compared GEBCO_2020 Grid. grid accompanied Type Identifier (TID) Grid, giving information types source data GEBCO_2021 Grid based . primary GEBCO_2021 grid contains land ice surface elevation information - provided previous GEBCO grid releases. addition, 2021 release, made available version -ice topography/bathymetry information Greenland Antarctica "ETOPO1 bathymetry": ETOPO1 1 arc-minute global relief model Earth's surface integrates land topography ocean bathymetry "ETOPO2 bathymetry": 2-Minute Gridded Global Relief Data (ETOPO2v2c) "Bedmap2": Bedmap2 suite gridded products describing surface elevation, ice-thickness sea floor subglacial bed elevation Antarctic south 60S "Revision Kerguelen Plateau bathymetric grid": digital elevation model (DEM) Kerguelen Plateau region "George V bathymetry": Digital Elevation Models (DEMs) varying resolutions George V Terre Adelie continental margin, derived incorporating available singlebeam multibeam point depth data "Geoscience Australia multibeam bathymetric grids Macquarie Ridge": compilation processed multibeam bathymetry data publicly available Geoscience Australia's data holding Macquarie Ridge "IBCSO bathymetry": International Bathymetric Chart Southern Ocean (IBCSO) Version 1.0 digital bathymetric model portraying seafloor circum-Antarctic waters south 60S. IBCSO Version 1.0 compiled available bathymetric data collectively gathered 30 institutions 15 countries, including multibeam single-beam echo soundings, digitized depths nautical charts, regional bathymetric gridded compilations, predicted bathymetry "IBCSO chart printing": IBCSO Poster, 2013, polar stereographic view Southern Ocean displaying bathymetric contours south 60S scale 1:7,000,000 "IBCSOv2 bathymetry": International Bathymetric Chart Southern Ocean Version 2 (IBCSO v2) digital bathymetric model area south 50S special emphasis bathymetry Southern Ocean. IBCSO v2 resolution 500 m x 500 m Polar Stereographic projection. total data coverage seafloor 23.79 "RTOPO-1 Antarctic ice shelf topography": consistent dataset Antarctic ice sheet topography, cavity geometry, global bathymetry "Radarsat Antarctic digital elevation model V2": high-resolution Radarsat Antarctic Mapping Project (RAMP) digital elevation model (DEM) combines topographic data variety sources provide consistent coverage Antarctica. Version 2 improves upon original version incorporating new topographic data, error corrections, extended coverage, modifications "New Zealand Regional Bathymetry 2016": NZ 250m gridded bathymetric data set imagery, Mitchell et al. 2012, released 2016 "Cryosat-2 digital elevation model": digital elevation model Antarctica derived 6 years continuous CryoSat-2 measurements "Natural Earth 10m physical vector data": Natural Earth public domain map dataset available 1:10m, 1:50m, 1:110 million scales "GSHHG coastline data": Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical, High-resolution Geography Database "Shuttle Radar Topography Mission elevation data SRTMGL1 V3": Global 1-arc-second topographic data generated NASA's Shuttle Radar Topography Mission. Version 3.0 (aka SRTM Plus Void Filled) removes void areas incorporating data sources ASTER GDEM "Reference Elevation Model Antarctica mosaic tiles": Reference Elevation Model Antarctica (REMA) high resolution, time-stamped digital surface model Antarctica 8-meter spatial resolution (reduced-resolution, resampled versions). Accepts single spatial_resolution value "1km", "200m" [default], "100m", "8m" "EGM2008 GIS Data": Global 2.5 Minute Geoid Undulations.
